newsitem.title: USA: Bridgestone sees gains with new contract.
newsitem.headline: Bridgestone sees gains with new contract.

text.p: Bridgestone/Firestone said Friday its new contract with the United Steelworkers of America positions the company to compete effectively in the global marketplace.
"This contract includes long-term benefits for the company and employees alike," said Trevor Hoskins, a spokesman for the Bridgestone Corp subsidiary.
"Our goal was to obtain a contract that enables us to compete effectively. We believe we have accomplished this, and the company, its customers and its employees will benefit from this agreement."

The three-year agreement authorizes the company to operate its tire plants 24 hours a day, seven days a week -- putting it on par with practices at many other U.S. tire and rubber manufacturing companies, the company explained.
It also includes performance-based pay incentives that give associates the opportunity to increase their earnings through increased productivity.

Bridgestone/Firestone said strengthening the relationship between management and employees and creating unity of purpose is crucial to long-term success. It also hopes to work closely with Steelworker leadership to ensure the continuation of a safe work environment.
"It's no secret that we've had a tough and divisive labor dispute," Hoskins said. "Now, we must turn our sights to the future." -- New York Newsdesk 212-859-1610
